Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Missing RobotsHonoringPolicy
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=2cIMy1UIOwuY5RyDS23oQ2IMxAsmPE_FHwVCgytaWlHO
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

Work related to the following issue has streamlined how robots-policies 
are configured:

   https://webarchive.jira.com/browse/HER-1803

Now, a single (sheet-overlayable) string setting on CrawlMetadata, 
'robotsPolicyName', can switch the effective policy. This string can be 
'obey' (or 'classic') for the default robots.txt-following behavior, or 
'ignore' for completely ignoring robots.txt, or the bean-name of another 
(possibly completely customized/scripted) instance of the new simplified 
'RobotsPolicy' type.

When running from development builds – which we appreciate, as it helps 
test prerelease code more thoroughly in real situations – you may want 
to keep an eye on the 'roadmap' for issues in progress for upcoming 
releases. See:

https://webarchive.jira.com/browse/HER#selectedTab=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.project%3Aroadmap-panel

There's also a draft of Release Notes (mentioning this and other notable 
changes) for the coming-soon 3.1 release here:

https://webarchive.jira.com/wiki/display/Heritrix/%28unreleased%29+Release+Notes+-+3.1.0

- Gordon @ IA

On 4/12/11 11:15 AM, Gérard Dupont wrote:
>
>
> Hi all,
>
> I'm trying to set up a specific Robots honoring policy, however the
> sample commented in CXML is obsolete:
> <bean id="robotsHonoringPolicy"
> class="org.archive.modules.net.RobotsHonoringPolicy">
> <property name="type" value="IGNORE" />
> </bean>
> Since I'm using Heritrix 3.1.1-SNAPSHOT, the
> class org.archive.modules.net.RobotsHonoringPolicy is not found any
> more. Is this a package change ? Class name change ? Do you have any
> recent CXML example ?
>
> cheers
